snippet.title: Wild Rumours About A Secretive New Star Trek Project
snippet.content:
Rumours are circulating about the story of the next James Bond movie, including the return of some familiar faces. Brie Larson discusses the expectations of starring in Captain Marvel. New Flash set pictures reveal an updated suit for Barry Allen. Plus, American Horror Story: Cult loses a regular and a new Preacher clip. Spoilers now!
James Bond 25
British tabloid claims that the next James Bond film now has the working title Shatterhand and will be based on the 2001 Raymond Benson novel, Never Dream Of Dying. Bond 25 will also allegedly borrow story elements from both You Only Live Twice and On Her Majesty's Secret Service, and both Christophe Waltz and Dave Bautista will return as Blofeld ("Shatterhand", of course, being the alias Blofeld used in You Only Live Twice) and Mr Hinx, respectively.
Blade Runner 2049
Hans Zimmer will score the film with Johann Johnson and Benjamin Wallfisch, according to the French publication .
X-Men: Dark Phoenix
Child actress Summer Fontana posted a photograph from Montreal, which naturally lead to that she'll be playing the young(er) Jean Grey in flashback scenes.
Captain Marvel
Brie Larson spoke to about the "pressure" of playing Carol Danvers.
It
The has confirmed the film has a 135 minute runtime.
Mayhem
has the first poster for Mayhem, a horror film starring The Walking Dead's Steven Yeun, about a man framed for corporate espionage on the day a deadly virus spreads through the office building.
Han Solo
Woody Harrelson told he thinks Han Solo could be "one of the funnier" Star Wars movies:
Godzilla: Planet of the Monsters
has a detailed rundown of Godzilla's first animated film - including a photo of "Servum", a dragon-like kaiju new to the franchise.
Star Trek: Khan
claims that Nicholas Meyer - the writer-director of the iconic Trek movie Wrath of Khan - is developing a miniseries based around Khan for CBS.
Meyer (who has been working Discovery as well, and has he's had a second Trek project in the works beyond that) is allegedly crafting a prequel series that would show the events between the original Star Trek episode that saw Kirk dump Khan and his followers on Ceti Alpha V, "Space Seed", and the villain's return in Wrath of Khan. Nothing's been confirmed yet, so take this with a pinch of genetically-enhanced salt for now.
Jessica Jones
reports that J.R. Ramirez has joined the cast of season two as Oscar, a single father who becomes the new superintendent of Jessica's building.
The Flash
reports that Hartley Sawyer has been cast as Ralph Dibney, better known as the DC superhero the Elongated Man.
In related news, a recent set pic reveals Barry's new costume for season four - a minor, slightly vein-ier update to the speedster's suit.
American Horror Story: Cult
Kathy Bates will not be returning for the new season, according to .
The Dark Tower (TV)
Director Nikolaj Arcel says the is still in the works, and will still be canon with the events of the film.
[]
Preacher
Tulip uncovers a box of Boo Berry in a clip from this week's episode, "Holes".
Krypton
The show's executive producers - along with star Cameron Cuffe - had a chat with TV Line about Syfy's .
Stretch Armstrong and the Flex Fighters
Finally, has the first image from Netflix's Stretch Armstrong series - now titled Stretch Armstrong and the Flex Fighters. If the futuristic flight suits didn't tip you off, this won't be your parent's Stretch Armstrong.
Banner art by Jim Cooke.
WATCH MORE: Entertainment News
